alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook; Southern Penobscot; Southern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 12:26PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Piscataquis and southern Penobscot Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1223 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Grand Falls, or 10 miles southeast of Howland, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Heavy to torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. IMPACT...Ponding of water on roadways. Slow down in heavy downpours to prevent hydroplaning of your vehicle on road surfaces. Locations impacted include... Lincoln, Bangor, Old Town, Howland, Orono, Hermon, Corinth, Milo, Medway, Kenduskeag, Springfield, Orneville, Licoln Township, East Corinth, Grand Falls, Lake View Plantation, Glenburn, Milford, Levant and Enfield. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 197 and 241. State Highway 11 between East Corinth and Bradford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Penobscot; Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook; Southern Penobscot; Southern Piscataquis
